name: Comedians Online Quiz | Comedians Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the male star of 'Your Show Of Shows'?
questions.explanation:
Sid Caesar.

	His female co-star was Imogene Coca.

questions.text: Who was the comedian who played the Cowardly Lion in 'The Wizard Of Oz'?
questions.explanation:
Bert Lahr.

	One of our classic movies.

questions.text: What Canadian comedian is a noted impressionist?
questions.explanation:
Rich Little & Little.

	A talent who can be just about anybody through his impressions.

questions.text: Who was a regular on 'Hollywood Squares' from 1966 to 1979?
questions.explanation:
Paul Lynde.

	He had the honor of being the center square for many years.

questions.text: What silent film star appeared in the 1931 film 'City Lights'?
questions.explanation:
Charlie Chaplin.

	One of the great early comedians.

questions.text: Which of these stand-up comedians was known in his prime for extremely insulting humor?
questions.explanation:
Don Rickles.

	All of them threw insults at one time or another, but Don was the king.

questions.text: Who played Barney Fife on 'The Andy Griffith Show'?
questions.explanation:
Don Knotts.

	The meek, shaky officer of the law.

questions.text: What comedian of the 1930s was known for his wide mouth?
What meek-looking actor played Mr. Peepers on television?
questions.explanation:
Wally Cox.

	Nye and Knotts were 2 of Steve Allen's men on the street, and Tim played in 'McHale's Navy'.

questions.text: What sad-faced comic was a regular on 'The Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour'?
